IRS990.MissionDesc: AT MCMASTER UNIVERSITY OUR PURPOSE IS THE DISCOVERY, COMMUNICATION AND PRESERVATION OF KNOWLEDGE. IN OUR TEACHING, RESEARCH, AND SCHOLARSHIP, WE ARE COMMITTED TO CREATIVITY, INNOVATION AND EXCELLENCE. WE VALUE INTEGRITY, QUALITY, INCLUSIVENESS AND TEAMWORK IN EVERYTHING WE DO. WE INSPIRE CRITICAL THINKING, PERSONAL GROWTH, AND A PASSION FOR LIFELONG LEARNING. WE SERVE THE SOCIAL, CULTURAL, AND ECONOMIC NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY AND OUR SOCIETY.
IRS990.Desc: Operating Fund -- UNRESTRICTED GENERAL REVENUES AND EXPENSES THAT ARE DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE MISSION OF THE UNIVERSITY, EDUCATION AND ACTIVITIES SUPPORTING RESEARCH.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Research Fund -- RESEARCH-RELATED FUNDS EXTERNALLY RESTRICTED BY THE UNIVERSITY THAT HAVE A NON-EXPANDABLE REQUIREMENT AS WELL AS OTHER LEGAL REQUIREMENTS FOR USE AS AGREED UPON BY THE DONOR AND THE UNIVERSITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Ancillary Fund -- SALES OF GOODS AND SERVICES BY DEPARTMENTS THAT ARE DEFINED AS BEING SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE UNIVERSITY'S OPERATING ACTIVITIES OF EDUCATION AND RESEARCH. SUCH SALES MAY BE MADE TO THE UNIVERSITY COMMUNITY AND/OR EXTERNAL CLIENTS. ANCILLARY OPERATIONS ARE SELF-SUSTAINING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART III: Collections of all kinds (i.e., books, archives, art in the Museum) are used for education, research purposes and public enjoyment. PART V #4: The investment income earned from endowment funds provide sources of funding for scholarships and bursaries and endowed chair sponsorship of faculty positions.
McMaster University maintains an anti-discrimination policy on its website: www.mcmaster.ca
McMaster University receives annual grants from the province of Ontario and the agencies of the federal government of Canada.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: PRESIDENT AND FELLOWS OF HARVARD COLLEGE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: An institutional agreement is signed between McMaster and the grantee stating that the grantee institution is responsible for following the policies, procedures and regulations of the granting agency. At a minimum, an annual statement of expenditures is provided to McMaster and is reviewed for ineligible/non-compliance issues. McMaster can require an audit at any time, if necessary.

Further information regarding McMaster University's travel guidelines and travel policy can be found at the following weblinks: Travel guidelines & Policy: https://financial-affairs.mcmaster.ca/services/accounts-payable-reimbursem ents/travel-resources/

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I - Number of Contributions or Items Contributed
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The University is reporting in Part I, Column (b), the Number of items received. For contributions of securities, the University is reporting each separate gift (rather than each share received) as an item for this purpose.

Other program services include: Internal endowments: unrestricted contributions including unspent investment income which have been restricted by action of the Board. External endowments: external contributions, the principal of which is non-expendable pursuant to the restrictions by the donor, and income retained under the endowment capital protection policy. Externally restricted investment income to the extent it is allocated is included with deferred contributions and recognized as revenue when the related expenses are incurred. Unrestricted investment income is recognized as revenue during the period in which it is earned. Investment income from internal endowments is recorded as unrestricted revenue and transferred to internal endowments.

The Nominating Committee of the Board shall consider and recommend to the Board persons to be elected under Section 8(1)(b) of the 1976 Act, the membership and Chairs of Board Committees (and Vice-Chair if appropriate), Board members to serve on University / Hospital Liaison Committees, Honorary Governors, and the Chair, Vice-Chair(s), and Secretary of the Board, and such other offices as may be referred to the Committee by the Board.
FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE CONTROLLER OF FINANCIAL AFFAIRS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING. THE CONTROLLER OF FINANCIAL AFFAIRS WILL REVIEW THE RETURN FOR ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS A REMUNERATION COMMITTEE WHOSE PRIMARY FUNCTION IS TO RECOMMEND TO THE BOARD POLICIES REGARDING SALARIES, WAGES, BENEFITS AND OTHER FORMS OF REMUNERATION AND TO PROVIDE ADVICE, AS NECESSARY, TO THE UNIVERSITY ADMINISTRATION ADMINISTERING SUCH POLICIES.
THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE VIA THE UNIVERSITY'S WEBSITE OR UPON REQUEST FROM PUBLIC.

NO REPORTABLE COMPENSATION FROM RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. CERTAIN OFFICERS ARE ALSO OFFICERS/DIRECTORS OF RELATED ORGANIZATIONS BY VIRTUE OF THEIR RESPECTIVE POSITIONS AT MCMASTER UNIVERSITY. THE NUMBER OF HOURS DEVOTED TO RELATED ORGANIZATIONS' AFFAIRS ARE UNDETERMINED AS RESPONSIBILITIES ARE PERFORMED ON A NEED BASIS.
